Your
               
              Worship
               
              is
               
              deceived
              .
               
              The
               
              gown
               
              is
               
              made

speaker: TAILOR
text:
Just
               
              as
               
              my
               
              master
               
              had
               
              direction
              .

speaker: TAILOR
text:
Grumio
               
              gave
               
              order
               
              how
               
              it
               
              should
               
              be
               
              done
              .

speaker: GRUMIO
text: I gave him no order. I gave him the stuff.

speaker: TAILOR
text:
But
               
              how
               
              did
               
              you
               
              desire
               
              it
               
              should
               
              be
               
              made
              ?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Marry, sir, with needle and thread.

speaker: TAILOR
text:
But
               
              did
               
              you
               
              not
               
              request
               
              to
               
              have
               
              it
               
              cut
              ?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Thou hast faced many things.

speaker: TAILOR
text: I have.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Face not me. Thou hast braved many men;

speaker: GRUMIO
text: brave not me. I will neither be faced nor braved. I

speaker: GRUMIO
text: say unto thee, I bid thy master cut out the gown,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: but I did not bid him cut it to pieces. Ergo, thou

speaker: GRUMIO
text: liest.

speaker: TAILOR
text: Why, here is the note of the fashion to testify.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Read it.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: The note lies in ’s throat, if he say I said so.

speaker: TAILOR
text: “Imprimis, a loose-bodied gown—”

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Master, if ever I said “loose-bodied gown,”

speaker: GRUMIO
text: sew me in the skirts of it and beat me to death with

speaker: GRUMIO
text: a bottom of brown thread. I said “a gown.”

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Proceed.

speaker: TAILOR
text: “With a small-compassed cape—”

speaker: GRUMIO
text: I confess the cape.

speaker: TAILOR
text: “With a trunk sleeve—”

speaker: GRUMIO
text: I confess two sleeves.

speaker: TAILOR
text: “The sleeves curiously cut.”

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Ay, there’s the villainy.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Error i’ th’ bill, sir, error i’ th’ bill! I commanded

speaker: GRUMIO
text: the sleeves should be cut out and sewed

speaker: GRUMIO
text: up again, and that I’ll prove upon thee, though thy

speaker: GRUMIO
text: little finger be armed in a thimble.

speaker: TAILOR
text: This is true that I say. An I had thee in place

speaker: TAILOR
text: where, thou shouldst know it.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: I am for thee straight. Take thou the bill, give

speaker: GRUMIO
text: me thy mete-yard, and spare not me.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text: God-a-mercy, Grumio, then he shall have

speaker: HORTENSIO
text: no odds.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Well
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              in
               
              brief
              ,
               
              the
               
              gown
               
              is
               
              not
               
              for
               
              me
              .

speaker: GRUMIO
text: You are i’ th’ right, sir, ’tis for my mistress.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Go
              ,
               
              take
               
              it
               
              up
               
              unto
               
              thy
               
              master’s
               
              use
              .

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Villain, not for thy life! Take up my mistress’

speaker: GRUMIO
text: gown for thy master’s use!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Why, sir, what’s your conceit in that?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: O, sir, the conceit is deeper than you think

speaker: GRUMIO
text: for. Take up my mistress’ gown to his master’s use!

speaker: GRUMIO
text: O, fie, fie, fie!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Hortensio
              ,
               
              say
               
              thou
               
              wilt
               
              see
               
              the
               
              tailor
               
              paid
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
To
                 
                Tailor
                .
                 
              
              Go
              ,
               
              take
               
              it
               
              hence
              .
               
              Begone
              ,
               
              and
               
              say
               
              no
               
              more
              .

speaker: HORTENSIO
text:
Tailor
              ,
               
              I’ll
               
              pay
               
              thee
               
              for
               
              thy
               
              gown
               
              tomorrow
              .

speaker: HORTENSIO
text:
Take
               
              no
               
              unkindness
               
              of
               
              his
               
              hasty
               
              words
              .

speaker: HORTENSIO
text:
Away
              ,
               
              I
               
              say
              .
               
              Commend
               
              me
               
              to
               
              thy
               
              master
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Well
              ,
               
              come
              ,
               
              my
               
              Kate
              ,
               
              we
               
              will
               
              unto
               
              your
               
              father’s
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Even
               
              in
               
              these
               
              honest
               
              mean
               
              habiliments
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Our
               
              purses
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              proud
              ,
               
              our
               
              garments
               
              poor
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
For
               
              ’tis
               
              the
               
              mind
               
              that
               
              makes
               
              the
               
              body
               
              rich
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
               
              as
               
              the
               
              sun
               
              breaks
               
              through
               
              the
               
              darkest
               
              clouds
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
So
               
              honor
               
              peereth
               
              in
               
              the
               
              meanest
               
              habit
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
What
              ,
               
              is
               
              the
               
              jay
               
              more
               
              precious
               
              than
               
              the
               
              lark

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Because
               
              his
               
              feathers
               
              are
               
              more
               
              beautiful
              ?

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Or
               
              is
               
              the
               
              adder
               
              better
               
              than
               
              the
               
              eel

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Because
               
              his
               
              painted
               
              skin
               
              contents
               
              the
               
              eye
              ?

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
O
               
              no
              ,
               
              good
               
              Kate
              .
               
              Neither
               
              art
               
              thou
               
              the
               
              worse

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
For
               
              this
               
              poor
               
              furniture
               
              and
               
              mean
               
              array
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
If
               
              thou
               
              account’st
               
              it
               
              shame
              ,
               
              lay
               
              it
               
              on
               
              me
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
               
              therefore
               
              frolic
              !
               
              We
               
              will
               
              hence
               
              forthwith

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
To
               
              feast
               
              and
               
              sport
               
              us
               
              at
               
              thy
               
              father’s
               
              house
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
To
                 
                Grumio
                .
                 
              
              Go
              ,
               
              call
               
              my
               
              men
              ,
               
              and
               
              let
               
              us
               
              straight
               
              to
               
              him
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
               
              bring
               
              our
               
              horses
               
              unto
               
              Long-lane
               
              end
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
There
               
              will
               
              we
               
              mount
              ,
               
              and
               
              thither
               
              walk
               
              on
               
              foot
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Let’s
               
              see
              ,
               
              I
               
              think
               
              ’tis
               
              now
               
              some
               
              seven
               
              o’clock
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
               
              well
               
              we
               
              may
               
              come
               
              there
               
              by
               
              dinner
               
              time
              .

speaker: KATHERINE
text:
I
               
              dare
               
              assure
               
              you
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              ’tis
               
              almost
               
              two
              ,

speaker: KATHERINE
text:
And
               
              ’twill
               
              be
               
              supper
               
              time
               
              ere
               
              you
               
              come
               
              there
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
It
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              seven
               
              ere
               
              I
               
              go
               
              to
               
              horse
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Look
               
              what
               
              I
               
              speak
              ,
               
              or
               
              do
              ,
               
              or
               
              think
               
              to
               
              do
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
You
               
              are
               
              still
               
              crossing
               
              it
              .
              —
              Sirs
              ,
               
              let
               
              ’t
               
              alone
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
I
               
              will
               
              not
               
              go
               
              today
              ,
               
              and
              ,
               
              ere
               
              I
               
              do
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
It
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              what
               
              o’clock
               
              I
               
              say
               
              it
               
              is
              .

speaker: HORTENSIO
text:
Why
              ,
               
              so
              ,
               
              this
               
              gallant
               
              will
               
              command
               
              the
               
              sun
              !
